ratings.question_text: Overall, how would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other Yale courses you have taken:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
What is your overall rating of the primary instructor?
The primary instructor's sensitivity to students and ability to provide students with adequate feedback was:

narratives.question_text: Indicate the total number of hours per week (outside the classroom) you spent on this course:
comments: Maybe 2 hours a week.
Readings and the assignments probably took about 3 hours per week
2 hours

narratives.question_text: Looking back on this course, what is your overall assessment of the course:  What are its strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might it be improved?
comments: Great overview of cancer epi. Wish there would be more cancer biology.

strengths: covered a wide range of topics, and never got dull because we often learned about two completely different topics in the same week. There was a wonderful overlap with both Epi II/ Measurement issues which I found to be very beneficial to really hone in on certain conceptsweaknesses: I think that some of the lectures may have been a little challenging for people without a science background to fully understand
The course was very informative and did a good job of covering all aspects of cancer epidemiology. The guest lecturers were extremely interesting.
Great introduction to cancer basics and various types of the most common cancers. The assignments were thought provoking and interesting.
Enjoyed the breadth of topics discussed in this course. As a lot of the lectures are from faculty outside the course, at times some lectures were not as beneficial as others.
Interesting guest lectures, but sometimes too technical instead of focusing on the broader message
I thought this was an extremely interesting and beneficial course that reinforced epidemiological concepts while providing new and interesting information and perspectives on cancer epidemiology.

This course provides a great overview of topics in cancer epidemiology. I liked how the course was structured and most lectures were clear and concise. Dr. Cartmel's presentations were particularly informative. I would have liked a little more discussion (15-20 minutes at the end of class to discuss the readings), but overall the course was very strong.

narratives.question_text: Please evaluate the instructor of this course. What are the instructor's strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might his or her teaching be improved?
comments: Instructor: Brenda Cartmel  A-
Instructor: Brenda Cartmel  She is a very caring and excellent professor. Highly recommend.
Instructor: Brenda Cartmel  Very knowledgeable and passionate about the topic. Brought in many great lecturers so that experts could teach us about their areas of expertise.

Instructor: Brenda Cartmel  Dr. Cartmel is very pleasant, friendly, and an excellent speaker. She genuinely loves cancer research and this was transparent. She has a very strong background in the field and I appreciated learning from her experience. I very much enjoyed her classes.

Instructor: Brenda Cartmel  Brenda was great at facilitating knowledge through bringing in speakers with specific knowledge of different cancer types, and she did a great job in her lectures as well providing background and depth about cancer in general.
Instructor: Brenda Cartmel  Dr. Cartmel was a great instructor. She really wants her students to do well and learn this material.
Instructor: Brenda Cartmel  Has first-hand knowledge about cancer research and selected interesting guest lecture topics.
Instructor: Brenda Cartmel  Dr. Cartmel is such a sweet, wonderful professor. Her lectures were very interesting, and she chose fantastic speakers to complement the course.

Instructor: Brenda Cartmel  Dr. Cartmel is very knowledgeable and responsive to students. I always enjoyed attending her lectures and learning about the research that she and other Yale faculty are involved in. She provided hard copies of the lecture notes, which was great since it discouraged laptop use and encouraged student engagement. With her experience in cancer research and personable teaching style, she makes this course interesting and rewarding.

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize this course for a fellow student? Would you recommend it to another student? Why or why not?
comments: Great class, highly recommend.
broad range of cancer types/topics/ learning about measurement issues with specific cancers- definitely would reccommend if you are interested in cancer
A very good, broad introduction to the field of cancer epidemiology.
I would definitely recommend this course. It was a great framework about some of the predictive and prognostic factors regarding multiple different types of cancer.
A great course to get exposed to cancer and cancer epidemiology.
I would recommend this course for anyone who wants a general understanding of a broad range of cancers.
I would highly recommend this course to a fellow student!
This course provides a great overview of topics in cancer epidemiology, but it is still worthwhile for students who are not pursuing research careers in cancer epidemiology.
